name: Gold Mine
editorial_summary: No frills Chinese restaurant for signature roast duck and Cantonese specialities from classic menu.

reviews.text: Serves authentic chinese cuisines including Malaysian styled curry.  I heard about the Malaysian fried fish curry which is not on the menu.  I loved it.  The fried meat tofu is average. Great service for a very popular and busy restaurant. Very attentive staff.  Highly recommended for good quality food and excellent service.

Authentic Chinese restaurant ‚ú® ‚Äî it really feels like a proper yum cha spot with the round tables ü™ë and traditional d√©cor üèÆ

üî∏Service:
The waitress was very welcoming üòä and even arranged the best seat for us. As usual in Chinese dining, we started with hot tea üçµ (you can choose your own ‚Äî we went with chamomile üåº this time).

üî∏Food:

üçú Fried Beef Noodles üçú ‚Äì My favorite! The black bean sauce ü´ò mixed perfectly with the beef ü•© and noodles, with onion üßÖ and sweet peppers ü´ë balancing it out.

üç§ Crystal Prawn Dumplings (Har Gow) üç§‚Äì 4 pieces, fresh and delicious ü¶ê.

ü•ü Scallop & Prawn Siu Mai ü•ü ‚Äì 4 pieces, juicy and flavorful.

ü•¨ Steamed Veg & Meat Dumplings ü•¨ ‚Äì 3 pieces, loved the crystal wrapper with the veggie mix inside.

üç≤ Beef Cheong Fun (Rice Roll) üç≤ ‚Äì Soft rice roll drizzled with soy sauce, very tasty.

üç° Dessert: Black Sesame Glutinous Rice Balls üç° ‚Äì Soft, slightly chewy, with rich sesame filling üñ§. (Fun fact: black sesame is great for hair & skin ‚ú®).

üî∏Overall: A truly authentic Chinese dining experience ü•¢, not the usual localized ‚ÄúBritish-Chinese.‚Äù Food, service, and atmosphere were all spot on üåü. Definitely coming back, and highly recommend it to anyone who wants the real deal ‚úÖ.

I had passed by Gold Mine many times and noticed there always seemed to be a queue of people waiting outside during the day.  I checked online and found they are popular for their dim sum but also their roast meat.  I decided to pay them a visit as I love duck and pork dishes.

My first impression was good as they were happy for me to make a reservation for one person and were very responsive to my requests.

I had a three-course meal of Deep Fried Crispy Aromatic Duck, Roast Meat Rice (BBQ Pork and Crispy Pork) and Banana Fritters.  I had also planned to have the House Special Bean Curd but had no room after my main course.

All the dishes I had were delicious.  The duck was probably the best I have ever had.  It was crispy on the outside and the meat was not at all dry but succulent.  I had no problem finishing all the pancakes.  I asked for egg fried rice and it was well cooked, along with the two types of pork.  The pork meats were full of flavour but not overpowering.  The banana fritters were a great end to the meal.  Crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.

The service was also very good.  The servers were attentive but not at all intrusive and I did not have to wait very long at all between courses.

One thing to note is that the restaurant was rather noisy and not the best place for a quiet or intimate meal.  I was glad that I had my noise cancelling headphones with me.  I would also recommend making a reservation, as it was very busy.

I definitely recommend Gold Mine if you fancy having Chinese cuisine, especially their roast meat dishes.  I hope to make another visit soon to try their dim sum, as it looks very good.

Time after time, we have gone back to visit Chris and his team at Bayswater. Food's great, fast and very efficient in the service. Always good to go before lunch and dinner crowd. Thank you for the many years of great food.

Delicious traditional Chinese fare in a casual atmosphere.  Service was efficient and friendly.

I ordered the pork dumplings, chef recommended chili chicken special (served cold, see photo), and a side of egg fried rice.  Prices are steep for a Chinese restaurant, but I think this is typical in the UK.

I also ordered a dry martini, which tasted too sweet and as soon as I let the server know, she immediately took the item off the bill.

This place reminded me so much of a typical Cantonese style dim sum restaurant in New York Chinatown so there was a touch of sweet nostalgia for me.

All in all, I would come to this restaurant again and again!
